impact_weight: The implementation of competitive agriculture targets may lead to increased transportation needs, potentially constraining the options for transport logistics and contributing to increased emissions.

The development of competitive agriculture can reinforce the adoption of net-zero technology in road vehicles, as farmers may invest in electric or hybrid vehicles to reduce their carbon footprint and improve efficiency.
Improving social security and workers' protection can enable the creation of better working conditions in the urban mobility sector, leading to increased job satisfaction and reduced turnover rates.
Reducing pesticide use can counteract the production of biofuels, as some biofuels rely on pesticide-intensive crops, potentially limiting the availability of sustainable biofuels.
Ensuring food affordability can enable the creation of healthier and more sustainable food options, which can have a positive impact on food quality and the overall well-being of consumers.

The development of healthy food options can reinforce the adoption of net-zero technology in road vehicles, as consumers may prioritize sustainable and healthy food choices, leading to increased demand for eco-friendly transportation options.
